Description:
1/0 are treated different when set in birt:param tag. No errors for 1 but errors for 0.

Build number:2.2.0.v200701091110

Steps to reproduce:
Prepare a report with a boolean parameter.
1. New a jsp file based on birt template.
2. Input content as below:
<birt:report id="4"
             reportDesign="param8.rptdesign" height="500" width="500">
       <birt:param name="p1_b" value="0"/>
</birt:report>
<birt:viewer id="2"
             reportDesign="param8.rptdesign" height="500" width="500">
       <birt:param name="p1_b" value="1"/>
</birt:viewer>
3. Preview the jsp file.

Expected result:
Errors for both report.

Actual result:
Error message for value 0 but no error message for value 1.

Error log:
org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.metadata.ValidationValueException: The value "0" is invalid with the type "boolean".
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.util.ParameterValidationUtil.doValidateBoolean(ParameterValidationUtil.java:556)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.util.ParameterValidationUtil.validate(ParameterValidationUtil.java:127)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.util.ParameterValidationUtil.validate(ParameterValidationUtil.java:368)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.model.api.util.ParameterValidationUtil.validate(ParameterValidationUtil.java:514)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.utility.DataUtil.validate(Unknown Source)
